intro: Anagallis kochii, commonly known as the pink sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Anagallis kochii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal dunes.
